intro: Atitara, commonly known as the "false arrowhead," is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like芋 (taro) and peace lilies. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves that are often variegated with shades of green, white, and yellow. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Atitara is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
